intro: Rhynchospora trichodes, commonly known as the hairy spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features slender, triangular stems with dense, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered with fine hairs, giving it its common name. Rhynchospora trichodes plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
